commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Everyone! Wake up, wake up!

commands.speaker: Everyone
commands.line: Wah?!

commands.speaker: Ruby
commands.line: Eeek!

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: Zura?!

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: Wh-What is it?!

commands.speaker: Ruby
commands.line: It's only 5:30 in the morning.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Chika, what's going on?

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Everyone, look outside! Look!

commands.speaker: Riko
commands.line: Whoa, it's so bright. Huh?

commands.speaker: You
commands.line: The sky is blue. Wait, then where's the typhoon?

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: Hold on a sec! Turn on the weather!

commands.speaker: Announcer
commands.line: The typhoon passed over the Kanto region last night and went out to the Pacific Ocean as of this morning. It is expected to weaken over--

commands.speaker: You
commands.line: All right! The typhoon passed over us!

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: Muahahaha! See that, heavenly father?! My power is so great, even a typhoon runs in fear from me! Tears from the heavens and riotous winds have no effect on the great Yohane!

commands.speaker: Ruby
commands.line: I'm sure the teru teru bozu dolls worked! Our wishes and prayers reached God's ears!

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: It's a miracle, zura! Maybe now we can still have the festival today!

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: The Festival Committee still hasn't contacted me, but I think they will soon.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: Shall we get dressed and get ready then? We should be prepared to move at a moment's notice.

commands.speaker: Everyone
commands.line: Yeah!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: What a beautiful blue sky. I guess this only happens after a storm passes.

commands.speaker: Riko
commands.line: The weather kept saying it was going to be bad on Saturday and Sunday. I guess they're wrong sometimes, too.

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: Everyone! I just got a call from the Summer Festival Committee.

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Mari, what did they say?!

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: Today is canceled too, apparently.

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Wh-Why? It's beautiful outside! It's not even that windy!

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: The weather isn't the problem. The wind and rain from last night scattered branches and garbage everywhere, so they had to cancel.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: It seems like the decorations, food carts, and even the special stage are damaged.

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: But it's so beautiful outside. How could the town and the venue turn out like this?

commands.speaker: Ruby
commands.line: Oh no... So if we don't do anything, it's all over?

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Mari... Is the festival canceled 100%?

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: Yes. They're going to make an official announcement soon. Everyone is going to clean up the town and pack up instead.

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: This can't be happening.

commands.speaker: Riko
commands.line: They're going to take down everything without using it. I don't like it.

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: What a shame, zura. I wanted everyone to hear that tourist info skit.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Wait, if they haven't made the announcement yet, then no one in town knows it's canceled, right?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: If we can get the whole town to take everything down and clean up, then can't we get everyone to fix the festival venue instead?

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: Wait a moment. It's unfortunate the festival is canceled, but we can't get everything fixed so quickly.

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: If we're talking about can and can't, I think we can. We have enough people.

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: It's possible that if people are willing to take things down, they will be willing to repair, too.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Hey Chika. What do you think?

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: M-Me?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: You said yourself that we have to do everything we can. That we shouldn't give up hope until the very end.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: There's still hope. Chika, are you going to give up?

commands.speaker: Riko
commands.line: Chika...

commands.speaker: You
commands.line: Chika, what will you do?

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: No. I don't want to give up yet.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Chika...!

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: We worked so hard to prepare for the festival. The last thing I want is for it all to be for nothing! I want to have this festival!

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: That's what I was waiting to hear, Chika-chi.

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: M-Mari!

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: Not only Chika, but you too. You both are impossible.

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: I like it, though!

commands.speaker: You
commands.line: The typhoon did its thing in one day. I'm sure we can do our thing with the festival too.

commands.speaker: Riko
commands.line: Today is going to get really busy. Picking up trash, repairing decorations and the stage. Is there something we can do with the stage?

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: If we're going to work a lot, we better eat, zura!

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: I thought you would say that. However, I must agree with you this time. Yohane must recharge the power she used creating this wonderful weather.

commands.speaker: Ruby
commands.line: I'll do my very, very Rubesty today, too!

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: All right, then. Now we need to convince the Festival Committee. It'll be a great opportunity to show my negotiating skills.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I'm sure it will be fine. I have a feeling a future, bright with smiles, is waiting for us.
